title: Breakfast Casserole
instructions: Cook meat and onions, drain.  Mix with remaining ingredients and pour into a greased 9X13 inch pan.  Bake at 350 degrees for 35-40 minutes.  Let stand 10 minutes before cutting and serving.

title: Buttermilk Syrup
instructions: Melt butter and add buttermilk and sugar.  Bring to a boil.  Add vanilla and baking soda and remove from heat.  Serve over French toast and berries.

title: Cottage Cheese Pancakes
instructions: Mix all dry ingredients.  Mix in milk, cottage cheese, melted butter, egg yolks, and vanilla.  Whip egg whites until stiff and then fold into mixture.  Cook on a hot griddle until golden on both sides.  Serve with Butter-Maple Syrup.

title: Butter Maple Syrup
instructions: In a medium sauce pan, bring sugar and water to a boil over high heat.  Remove from heat and add maple flavor, salt, cream of tartar, and butter.  Stir until butter melts.  In a bowl, whip the egg until frothy.  Stir in a couple of spoonfuls of hot syrup to egg mixture and then add the egg mixture to the syrup and stir well.  Return to heat and cook for 2 more minutes.  Serve over pancakes.

title: Crapes
instructions: Mix all ingredients in a blender.  Strain through a sieve.  Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat.  Spray with non-stick cooking spray.  Spoon about 3 tablespoons of batter onto the hot skillet and spread in circular motion with the back of a spoon.  Cook until the edges of the crape are light brown, about 45 seconds.  Loosen with a spatula and flip.  Cook on the other side for 20 seconds then remove from the pan. Repeat until the batter is used up.  Serve crapes with strawberry filling and powdered sugar.

title: Strawberry Filling
ingredients: 1 quart of strawberries, washed and sliced
instructions: Mix all ingredients in a blender.  Strain through a sieve.  Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat.  Spray with non-stick cooking spray.  Spoon about 3 tablespoons of batter onto the hot skillet and spread in circular motion with the back of a spoon.  Cook until the edges of the crape are light brown, about 45 seconds.  Loosen with a spatula and flip.  Cook on the other side for 20 seconds then remove from the pan. Repeat until the batter is used up.  Serve crapes with strawberry filling and powdered sugar.

title: Crispy Chicken Burritos
instructions: Heat cream cheese in the microwave for about 20-30 seconds so it’s soft and easy to stir.  Add green salsa, lime juice, and seasonings.  Stir in cilantro, green onions, chicken, and cheese.  Heat tortillas in the microwave until softened.  Place about a ¼ cup of chicken/cheese filling on a tortilla and roll up tightly.  Place on a greased baking sheet seam side down.  Repeat until all of the filling is used up.  Spray the tops of the burritos lightly with cooking spray and then sprinkle with kosher salt on top.  Bake at 425 degrees for 15-20 minutes until light brown and crispy.

title: Eclair Cake
ingredients: 2 small boxes of instant vanilla pudding
instructions: Mix pudding and milk until dissolved.  Put in refrigerator until set, fold in cool whip.  Layer graham crackers in a 9x13” pan.  Pour half of pudding mixture over crackers then top with another layer of cracker, remaining pudding and a final layer of crackers.  Mix the frosting until smooth and pour over the top layer of crackers.  Refrigerate for several hours.

title: Egg Rolls
ingredients: 1 bunch of green onions, finely chopped
2-3 chicken breasts, cooked and finely chopped
instructions: Mix vegetables, chicken, and seasonings together in a bowl.  Place 2 heaping spoonfuls of mixture in the center of a wrapper, roll up, and secure with water.  Deep fry in hot oil until golden brown.

title: Granola
instructions: Mix oats, cinnamon, sat, and brown sugar in a bowl.  In another bowl microwave honey 30 seconds and then add oil and vanilla and then pour over the oat mixture.  Mix well and then spread on a greased cookie sheet.  Bake at 300 degrees for 30 minutes.  Cool completely and then store in an air tight container.

title: Green Bean Stir Fry
instructions: Heat oil in a skillet.  Stir fry chicken, add green beans and water chestnuts and stir fry until beans get partially browned.  In a bowl stir together remaining ingredients.  Pour over chicken and vegetables stirring continually until sauce boils and thickens.  Remove from heat and serve over rice. Option:  Beef and Broccoli - Replace chicken, beans, and water chestnuts with steak and broccoli flowerets.  Use beef bouillon instead of chicken.

title: Henry Pasta
instructions: In a large skillet, cook bacon then drain fat.  Add tomatoes, olive oil, butter, and seasonings.  Simmer for 10 minutes.  Add peas and cream.  Bring to a boil and then immediately remove from the heat and serve.

title: Homemade Oreos
instructions: Mix together and roll into balls.   Place on a greased cookie sheet and bake at 350 degrees for 8 minutes.  Cool completely and then frost. For frosting, beat with electric beaters until smooth.

title: Hummus
instructions: Add all ingredients to a food processor or blender and mix until smooth.  Serve with bread, crackers, or vegetables.  Makes 3 cups.

title: Sticky Chicken Finger Wraps
instructions: Mix and add to apx 8 breaded chicken fingers to be used for wraps.

title: Sweet Pork
instructions: Put pork in crock pot and fill it half way up the pork with water.  Cook on high for 5 hours.  Drain off water and shred meat.  Mix together salsa, brown sugar, and Coke and pour over the pork.  Cook an additional 3 hours on high.  Serve in burritos or salads (lettuce, green ranch, pico, black beans, avacato, chips, cheese, and limes).

title: Chad's Dutch Oven Artisan Bread
instructions: Mix Dry Ingredients ensuring you don't pour the yeast on top of the salt which can kill the yeast. Add 2 cups Water 130 degrees. Mix Well using a rubber spatula. Add 1.5 Tbsp Olive Oil and Mix Well and form ball. Cover with Plastic and  (Sealed Edges) set on the countertop for 3-5 hours (5 hours seems to work best). After the 5 hours, place dough on a floured surface. The dough will be very Sticky.  Sprinkle flour (light)  on top of dough.  Fold over 2-3 times with the flat end of a spatula until you can work with it. Add flour as you go. Form into ball. Place ball of dough into bowl or proofing basket with the smoothest side down and cover with a towel for 35 minutes. While waiting for the bread to proof, pre-heat the dutch oven and lid at 450 for 35 min. Take Lid off.  Remove dough from proofing and then place dough on parchment paper.  Lower dough into 400 preheated dutch oven and bake for 20 min. Remove lid and bake for another 10-15 minutes to brown top. Let rest before cutting.

title: Breakfast Casserole
ingredients: 3 cups cooked bacon (or sausage) Salt and pepper to taste
instructions: Press sautéed hash browns in 9 x 13 casserole dish. Combine other ingredients and pour over hash browns. Bake at 350 for about 45 min.

title: Christensen Cousin Potato Soup
instructions: 1. Chop up carrots, celery and however much onion you want. Sautee veggies in some butter for a few minutes until onions start to get tender, then add a little flour and stir that around a bit. 2. Pour in a box of chicken broth, or use bullion cubes. Add peeled/diced potatoes. You want enough liquid to cover the potatoes and veggies by about an inch. Bring to a boil and cook the soup until the potatoes are fork-tender. 3. Break up the potatoes a bit by using a potato masher at this point. It helps thicken the soup and gives a nice texture, but still leaves some potato chunks. Lower stove heat. 4. Grate some cheddar cheese into the soup, stir until it's melted. Add cream or milk to the soup - maybe a cup, depending on how thick you want.

title: Vicki's Rolls
ingredients: 1 stick butter (1/2 cup) 2 cups of warm water
2 1/2 to 3 more cups of flour in order to get it to the right consistency—not too sticky to roll out.
instructions: Cover and let rise for about 1 1⁄2 hours. Then punch it down and knead it. Roll the dough out and cut in circles, butter, and fold in half or cut in triangles, butter, and roll to make crescent rolls. Place on a greased cookie sheet. Cover rolls and let rise for 11/2 to 2 hours. Bake at 375 for about 15 minutes.

title: Lisa's Banana Bread
ingredients: 1/2 cup sour milk or 1/2 cup milk with 1 1/2 tsp. lemon juice
1 tsp. baking powder 1 tsp. baking soda 1/2 tsp. salt
instructions: 1. Cream butter and sugar & add eggs and sour milk 2. Combine dry ingredient & add dry ingredients to wet. 3. Stir in bananas & pour into 2 greased loaf pans. 4. Bake at 350 for 55-60 mins
